revised_title: Cyclic AMP in Relation to Spermatozoa Motility and Senescence
tldr: The study investigates the relationship between adenosine 3':5'-cyclic monophosphate (cyclic AMP) content in spermatozoa and their motility and senescence. The research shows that the determination of cyclic AMP content in spermatozoa is a sensitive indicator of sperm activity, useful in detecting the onset of declining motility and other changes associated with sperm senescence.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
